summary: This is a United States Attorney's Office (USAO-SDNY) internal memorandum (UMR #2021-06-67383) notifying the Office of the Attorney General and Deputy Attorney General about the planned release of approximately 2,700 pages of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide. The release is due to a court order in FOIA litigation with The New York Times, following deferred prosecution agreements with the two guards involved.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging while housed in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreements with Guards
events.description: USAO-SDNY entered into deferred prosecution agreements with correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, who were accused of falsifying records on the night of Epstein's suicide.

events.title: Planned Release of BOP Documents
events.description: The USAO-SDNY plans to release approximately 2,700 pages of BOP documents related to Epstein's incarceration and suicide to The New York Times as part of FOIA litigation.

locations: New York City Office of the Medical Examiner (OCME)
keyFacts: Approximately 2,700 pages of BOP documents regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide were scheduled for release on July 2, 2021, to The New York Times.
The documents were previously withheld due to the criminal prosecution of guards Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, which ended with deferred prosecution agreements in May 2021.
The documents include internal BOP memoranda, Epstein's psychological records, the autopsy report, and emails showing confusion and failures on the day of the suicide.

A notable item among the documents is a photograph of a defaced sign in the Special Housing Unit that stated rounds on Epstein were 'mandatory,' signed 'God,' with a question mark added after 'mandatory.'
The autopsy report by the New York City OCME concluded Epstein's death was a suicide by hanging.
